localize.text: As you know, a lot of employees are working for the company.
A majority of them want to know more about you.
Some will show initiative and approach you first.
It’s funny, knowing who you are in person doesn't improve the odds.
There are no regulations that prevent you from interacting with them in person.
It seems the one who made those rules didn’t consider situations like this.
It is a good opportunity for you to show that you care.
Words travel faster than you think.
I'm not going to stop someone from meeting you.
But you don't have to do everything they want.
Just thank them for their effort.
And tell them you hope they'll keep up the good work.
That’s a win-win, don’t you think?
Do you follow? What they- WE - need is a gesture of good will, and nothing more. Don't go overboard.
Give them a vending machine and next they will demand a bar.
I expect you to make the right decision.
